content.description: Climb anywhere left of the jugs and lap a few rounds of V0-V1. Good for warming up *duh*.
content.location: To the left of the large jugs on the Tulip Boulder (first boulder from parking lot).

content.description: Start on two crimps just to the right of the Warm Up Quadrant. All the jugs are off, as is the high knob. Traverse right to the start jug for Dankie Doobie et al, and finish on Dankie Doobie.
content.location: Boulder is the first one you see walking in from the parking lot. Walk past all the good holds and find two small crimps.

content.description: Start up Warmup, but then move right and continue traversing, staying at about middle height for ~10 ft.  When the bottom drops out of the boulder, drop your feet down with it so you can use the crimps and small handholds.  Continue traversing around right to the large crack.  Finish up the crack.  In summer, be careful of the poison ivy on the top-out.
content.location: Tulip Boulder.  Begin where Warmup starts.

content.description: Start on the large crack, and climb straight up through the nice holds.
content.location: Located on the backside (from the parking lot) of the Tulip boulder, right near where it meets the Tennies Mantle boulder.

content.description: Start on jugs in the center and make one move up to a jug on the lip.  Almost over before it starts, but    good practice for topping out (the top out over the lip is the + part of the problem).
content.location: On the northernmost point of Tennies Boulder (on the north side towards the trail) in the obvious depression between Tulip and Tennies.

content.description:
A slightly more technical variation using some of the lower and left-most holds from the warmup problem area. With low but good feet, Start with both hands in a left-ish-facing "crescent" shaped crimp/dish/thing, and move up to a left-facing side pull. From here use creative feet (different depending on height) to gain the juggy vertical crack just above and top out.

 Only the start hold, the side-pull, and everything in the crack is on (but top out using anything). I mean, you can try to find other holds, but most of what you have to work with are slopers so gl. I find that for my height (6-0) A foot stab out to the left is critical, whereas shorter folks may have to use a heel.
content.location: Same boulder face as warmup Â problem (left side of it)

content.description: On the Tennies Mantle boulder, sit start at Scum of the Heel, but instead of moving straight up, traverse out left and around to join Tennies.  It's somewhat of a blind reach around the corner but if you get the feet set you'll be fine.  Finish with mantle to top out on Tennies.
Start on a left hand crimp and a right hand undercling/sidepull, and move straight up to the lip. One move wonder.
content.location: On the backside of Tennies Mantle Boulder (on the north side towards the trail) in the obvious depression between Tulip and Tennies.

content.description: Sit start on the left end and traverse the lip up and right to top out at Tennies Mantle.
content.location: On the east side of Tennies Boulder - opposite from Tulip Boulder and the parking lot

content.description:
Same as Maui, but avoiding all good holds (except the start).  

  Sit start in the horizontal crack (under the small roof area - prepare to scrunch and watch the head). Move left on to the vertical crack and then straight up on small holds.
content.location: On the backside of Tulip Boulder (on the north side towards the trail) in the obvious depression between Tulip and Tennies.

content.description: Sit start in the horizontal crack (under the small roof area - prepare to scrunch and watch the head). Move left on to the vertical crack and then straight up on good holds.
content.location: On the backside of Tulip Boulder (on the north side towards the trail) in the obvious depression between Tulip and Tennies.

content.description: Cool face with rows of slopers. Sit start matched on a pinch, throw straight up to a sloper, and then move left and up on crimps to top out at the tallest point.Starts over shallow water, so requires repairing or building a basic platform.
content.location: Located on the backside of the very first boulder you come to on your right, just past the drainage ditch.

content.description: Start on the good jug same as Dankie Doobie and Center Face. Eliminate, in that everything but the holds described below is off for hands. Get your feet up high and go left to a sloper, then get your feet higher and bump further left to a crimp. Hang on and work your feet over until and can top out up the great jugs to your left (the rightmost part of the Warm Up Quadrant). Watch out for poison ivy at the top.
content.protection: 1-2 pads. Still plenty of sharp things and holes to twist an ankle in.
content.location: First boulder you see when you walk in from the Burnt Mills parking lot. Start is on the right side of the boulder on a chalked up jug.

content.description: Begin below and to the left of the jug start of Tennies Mantle. Climb right and continue up Tennies Mantle to the top out. Basically Tennies Mantle with one extra move and a more difficult start/footwork.
Locate the side of the Tulip Boulder facing the stream.Â
content.protection: None.  I wouldn't want to put a pad down there.
content.location: Streamside of the Tulip Boulder...watch the mud.

content.description: Start on the obvious triangular jug and go right to a small right hand gaston, and then up and right to a small jug. Top out to the right from there. The good juggy rail just above the start hold is off. It's really just a two move wonder. Watch out for the poison ivy at the top.
content.protection: 1-2 pads. Too many impale-y sticks and random holes to be a hero on this one.
content.location: First boulder you see when you walk in from the Burnt Mills parking lot. Walk past the nice, soft sandy landing to the sketchy mass of driftwood until you see an obvious jug about five feet off the ground.

content.description: Start with the large jug and climb straight upwards through the knob/crimp to the top.
content.protection: A pad and/or spotter on top of the debris and driftwood.
content.location: Begins on the Tulip Boulder on the upstream side. You may have to begin on some debris and driftwood.

content.description:
First set of boulder problems on the trail from the parking, with many folks passing from the parking lot.  

  Includes the Tulip Boulder (first boulder from parking lot) and the Tennies Mantle Boulder (right behind it).
